intro: Corispermum stenolepis f. psilocarpum, commonly known as the narrow-leaved corispermum, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Chenopodiaceae. It is characterized by its small, green, fleshy leaves and produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. The plant typically grows in saline or arid environments, demonstrating its adaptability to harsh conditions. It is found in regions such as Central Asia and parts of Europe. The subspecies is notable for its unique morphological features that distinguish it from other forms of Corispermum.
